sub_title: Software Developer at Cloudwise B.V.| 4+ years experience | Problem Solver
summary:
I am a software developer with 4+ years of work experience in the industry with acclaimed success in implementing and managing multiple digital solutions in different business domains. I am always keen to understand a problem in depth and work together as a team to achieve impactful milestones.

Apart from that, I enjoy going around places with friends, hiking, playing the guitar, swimming, and reading as well. I have a growing desire for photography as well.

awards:
[{'title': 'Information Security Quiz 2018', 'description': 'Cyber Security Week 2018 was the annual National Conference in Cyber Security in Sri Lanka. It was held for the 11th consecutive time this year. CSW 2018 consists of the following events,

 - 11th Annual National Conference (07-NOV-2018)
 - Technical Workshops (From 5-NOV-2018 onwards)
 - Hacking Challenge (10-OCT-2018)
 - Information Security Quiz (17-OCT-2018)

I was fortunate to be placed 4th in the Information security quiz.

Areas covered in each round of the quiz.

Round 1 - Basic Security Concepts
Round 2 – Cloud Security and Privacy 
Round 3 – Security tools
Round 4 – General Network Security Technologies 
Round 5 – Physical and environmental security
Round 6 – Cryptography 
Round 7 – Laws and standards related to computer security 
Round 8 – Software Development and Security', 'issuer': 'Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team Coordination Center', 'date': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, {'title': 'Hardware Based Virus Scaning Acceleration paper Published and presented at the 24th Annual Conference of the IET Sri Lanka Network', 'description': 'The 24th Annual Conference of the IET Sri Lanka Network was held on Saturday 26th August 2017 at Hotel Galadari. The conference was organized by the IET Sri Lanka Network focused on theory and applications covering topics related to Electrical, Electronics, Mechanical, Civil, Aeronautical, Marine, Communications, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, and Manufacturing. 

Published the paper "Hardware Based Virus Scaning Acceleration in this conference and presented it.

The conference is intended to provide a forum for the presentation of research papers, and to foster interaction between persons from industry and the universities.

Paper Authors  -> Rangana De Silva, Malitha Dilshan, Iranga Navaratna', 'issuer': 'IET Sri Lanka Network ', 'date': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, {'title': 'Present Around The World South Asian Regional Finals (Represented Sri lanka)', 'description': 'The IET’s Present around the World (PATW) is a well-established competition with several heats designed to encourage young engineers and technicians to develop their presentation skills in this fun and friendly environment. I was able to represent Sri Lanka at south Asian regional level competition of IET PATW.
Presented the published paper topic : Hardware based virus scaning acceleration.', 'issuer': 'IET Bangalore', 'date': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, {'title': 'Best Presenter in IET Present Around The World Conference 2017', 'description': 'A paper on the project Hardware based virus scanning acceleration was published and presented at the conference where I won the award for being the best presenter in the conference. This gave a chance to go to India, Bangalore to participate in IET PATW South Asian regional finals and represent Sri Lanka.', 'issuer': 'Institute of Engineering and technology', 'date': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, {'title': 'Participation in IET Present Around The World Conference 2017', 'description': 'A paper on the project Hardware based virus scanning acceleration was published and presented at the conference.', 'issuer': 'Institute of Engineering and Technology (IET)', 'date': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, {'title': 'Participation Aces Hackathon 2017', 'description': '> Product: FAT_TO_FIT (Fitness motivational IOT device)
> Team Members: Iranga Navaratne, Malitha Kumarasiri', 'issuer': None, 'date': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, {'title': 'ACES HACKATHON 2016 (1st Place)', 'description': 'Won 1st place in Software Development Category. 
Won the Prize for the Most Popular Idea of the competition.

> Team Members: Udaree Kanewela, Kesara Gamlath, Chandima B. Samarasinghe. Gihan Jayathilaka, Rangana De. Silva, Hasindu Ramanayake, Kalana Suraweera and Indika Kumara.', 'issuer': None, 'date': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}]

projects:
[{'title': 'Hardware Based Virus Scanning Acceleration', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Virus scanning is a time-consuming process which is vital to the security of any computer system. Signature-based detection is one of the most popular methods used in virus scanning. Signature-based detection comprises of two stages. First, a signature is calculated for a new file which might be dangerous. Then the signature is looked up in a database of known viruses to determine whether the new file is a virus. This project was focused on accelerating the signature calculating part by adding new application-specific instructions to the processor. The added instructions were to accelerate the MD5 algorithm. The new instructions were added to a five-stage pipelined MIPS processor. The modified processor with added instructions was tested on an FPGA board.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rangana', 'last_name': 'De Silva', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Software Developer at Cloudwise B.V.| 4+ years experience | Problem Solver'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Iranga', 'last_name': 'Navaratna', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Software Engineer'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Malitha Dilshan', 'last_name': 'Kumarasiri', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Software Engineer at CodeGen International'}]}, {'title': 'Auction Server', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'A simple java application to simulate an auction, where multiple users (four users) can log into a server in given time and bid on items and receive real time updates of the auction bid updates. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rangana', 'last_name': 'De Silva', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Software Developer at Cloudwise B.V.| 4+ years experience | Problem Solver'}]}, {'title': 'Fractals', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Fractals are infinitely complex patterns that are self-similar across different scales. They are created by repeating a simple process over and over in an ongoing feedback loop. Two well known fractals, Julia and Mandlebrot are formed with java. Change of parameters would result in different shapes/patterns of these fractals.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rangana', 'last_name': 'De Silva', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Software Developer at Cloudwise B.V.| 4+ years experience | Problem Solver'}]}, {'title': 'HardScope: Thwarting DOP with Hardware-assisted
Run-time Scope Enforcement', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'Follwing is the abstract of the contributed paper

"Widespread use of memory unsafe programming languages (e.g., C and C++) leaves many systems vulnerable to memory corruption attacks. A variety of defenses have been proposed to mitigate attacks that exploit memory errors to hijack the control flow of the code at run-time, e.g., (fine-grained) randomization or Control Flow Integrity. However, recent work on data-oriented programming (DOP) demonstrated highly expressive (Turing-complete) attacks, even in the presence of these state-of-the-art defenses. Although multiple real-world DOP attacks have been demonstrated, no efficient defenses are yet available. We propose run-time scope enforcement (RSE), a novel approach designed to efficiently mitigate all currently known DOP attacks by enforcing compile-time memory safety constraints (e.g., variable visibility rules) at run-time. We present HardScope, a proof-of-concept implementation of hardware-assisted RSE for the new RISC-V open instruction set architecture. We discuss our systematic empirical evaluation of HardScope which demonstrates that it can mitigate all currently known DOP attacks, and has a real-world performance overhead of 3.2% in embedded benchmarks."', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rangana', 'last_name': 'De Silva', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Software Developer at Cloudwise B.V.| 4+ years experience | Problem Solver'}]}, {'title': 'FATtoFIT (Fitness tracking Device', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': 'FATtoFIT is a wearable fitness tracking device which tracks workout details and motivates the users to engage more in physical activity. The electronics in the device include an Arduino Pro Mini microprocessor, accelerometer (MPU-6050) and a Bluetooth module (HC-06). This device is able to identify the count in exercises such as sit-ups, pushups, squats and running. Users can track their progress using an Android application which also motivates the user to workout regularly.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rangana', 'last_name': 'De Silva', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Software Developer at Cloudwise B.V.| 4+ years experience | Problem Solver'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Iranga', 'last_name': 'Navaratna', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Software Engineer'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Malitha Dilshan', 'last_name': 'Kumarasiri', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Software Engineer at CodeGen International'}]}, {'title': '16-bit RISC Microprocessor', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'A 16-bit RISC microprocessor was designed and implemented in Verilog. Modelsim was used for the implementation and debugging. This microprocessor supports about a dozen instructions and the ALU has basic functionalities such as AND operation, OR operation, addition, subtraction and set-on-less-than.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rangana', 'last_name': 'De Silva', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Software Developer at Cloudwise B.V.| 4+ years experience | Problem Solver'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Samurdhi', 'last_name': 'Karunaratne', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Deep Learning Inference @ NVIDIA'}]}, {'title': 'Simple Inventory Management System', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'A simple inventory management system designed for small enterprises. The database was implemeted using MySQL, the server side scripting was done using PHP and the interface was done using HTML and CSS.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rangana', 'last_name': 'De Silva', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Software Developer at Cloudwise B.V.| 4+ years experience | Problem Solver'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Iranga', 'last_name': 'Navaratna', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Software Engineer'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ashan', 'last_name': 'Perera', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Software Engineer at Percept Solutions'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'kalana', 'last_name': 'suraweera', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Software Developer at Credit Agricole CIB'}]}]
